alert.note: Alert for Harrison; Jackson (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 05 at 12:12PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Harrison and southwestern Jackson Counties through 1245 PM CDT... At 1211 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a waterspout in the Gulf near Gulfport, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Waterspouts and winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Waterspouts can easily overturn boats and create locally hazardous waters. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Gulfport, Biloxi, Ocean Springs, Long Beach, St. Martin, D`iberville, Gulf Hills, Gulf Park Estates and Gulfport Airport. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Mississippi near mile marker 30. Interstate 110 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 3. WATERSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
